meanings.sent1: She always acts so uppish around us, like she's better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: His uppish behavior made it hard for others to approach him.
meanings.sent3: Even her cat seemed to find her uppish attitude amusing.
meanings.sent4: The uppish cat strutted around the house as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent5: The uppish peacock flaunted its feathers, demanding attention.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to be snobbish or haughty.
meanings.sent1: The uppish lady turned her nose up at the simple meal offered to her.
meanings.sent2: His uppish remarks about the party guests offended many people.
meanings.sent3: The uppish squirrel refused to share its nuts with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The uppish clouds looked down on the earth below, casting shadows.
meanings.sent5: The uppish queen bee buzzed around the hive, commanding respect from the other bees.

meanings.definition: Behaving as if one is superior to others.
meanings.sent1: The uppish student always acted like he knew more than the teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her uppish attitude towards her colleagues made teamwork difficult.
meanings.sent3: The uppish toddler insisted on sitting at the head of the table during dinner.
meanings.sent4: The uppish rooster strutted around the farm, crowing loudly to assert dominance.
meanings.sent5: The uppish eagle soared high in the sky, looking down on all the other birds.
